topic: Deep dive: _codecs_kr standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _codecs_kr standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: _codecs_kr Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the _codecs_kr module, a part of Python's standard library introduced in version 3.12, which offers Korean codec support for handling various types of encoded text.
key_points: Understands and encodes/decodes common Korean encodings such as EUC-KR, UTF-8, and ASCII
Incorporates advanced functionality like automatic detection of encoding for a given data stream
Supports IANA charset names for easier cross-platform compatibility

code_examples.code:
with open('sample.txt', 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='replace') as f:
    print(_codecs.lookup('utf-8').decode(f.read()))

version_notes: Improvements and additions may be included in future versions of the standard library
caveats: Some encodings may not support all possible characters, resulting in data loss or replacement of unsupported characters
When working with user-supplied data, ensure proper validation and handling to prevent security vulnerabilities
